channel.title: Prayer Login
channel.description: Hows does one make it so that ancient curses stay instead of default back to the normal prayers upon relogging? This is PI

item.title: Prayer Login
item.dc:creator: @Code_kai Code kai
item.description:
@Code_kai wrote:

[quote=“i am infamy, post:9, topic:443889”]Lemme clarify things

Do you want it to set every player who log’s in automatically is already at the ancient curses prayer instead of normal prayer’s

Or do you want it where if a player switches to ancient prays (through a atler or command) and logs of and logs back on is still in ancient prays?[/quote]

Second one where a player switches to ancient curses.

Read full topic

item.title: Prayer Login
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“Code kai, post:8, topic:443889”]I tried this but found this part of the code you posted:

} else if (token.equals("Curses")) { p.curses = Boolean.parseBoolean(token2);

Where should I place the other part and declare it true again?[/quote]

Where ever your prayers are changed, there might be a method that changes it or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Prayer Login
item.dc:creator: @i_am_infamy i am infamy
item.description:
@i_am_infamy wrote:

Lemme clarify things

Do you want it to set every player who log’s in automatically is already at the ancient curses prayer instead of normal prayer’s

Or do you want it where if a player switches to ancient prays (through a atler or command) and logs of and logs back on is still in ancient prays?

item.title: Prayer Login
item.dc:creator: @Code_kai Code kai
item.description:
@Code_kai wrote:

I tried this but found this part of the code you posted:

} else if (token.equals("Curses")) { p.curses = Boolean.parseBoolean(token2);

Where should I place the other part and declare it true again?

Read full topic

item.title: Prayer Login
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

True, you could use a boolean.

Read full topic

item.title: Prayer Login
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[code]				} else if (token.equals("curses")) {
					p.curses = Boolean.parseBoolean(token2);[/code]

Then make the boolean value true when the prayer is on curses.

Read full topic

item.title: Prayer Login
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:3, topic:443889”]This may be a little messy, but make a character save that has an int, such as turmoil = 0, where if it is 0, it is off when they logged off, and if it is 1 it is on when they log off.

I’m not sure this would work, because it may have a default method that turns it off on login.[/quote]

He’s on about the two types of prayer.

Read full topic

item.title: Prayer Login
item.dc:creator: @Code_kai Code kai
item.description:
@Code_kai wrote:

Can you give me of an example?

Read full topic

item.title: Prayer Login
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

This may be a little messy, but make a character save that has an int, such as turmoil = 0, where if it is 0, it is off when they logged off, and if it is 1 it is on when they log off.

I’m not sure this would work, because it may have a default method that turns it off on login.

Read full topic
